Title: The Blue Lagoon / Return to the Blue Lagoon

reviewText: Blue Lagoon was a classic back in the "good old days" of RCA's Selectivision and Laser Disk. The price back in the day was a king's ransom. Today, thanks to Amazon, you can obtain not only the classic, but the rarely seen sequel as well. The price is fantastic and the entertainment value is phenomenal. Both features were filmed in the stunning South Pacific. Buy, especially great for viewing on a cold winter's night!
summary: A Classic Returns in a great double feature

Title: The Blue Lagoon / Return to the Blue Lagoon

reviewText: Ship crash survivors, a boy and a girl, made it to the island used to holy sacrificing by indigenous populations coming from and going to nowhere at full moon."Blue Lagoon" is utterly about sexual developments, teen exploitations and a sort of naivety mixed with nativity while a boy of this pare was saved by a ship for just returning with a female passenger and a daughter of her back to the same island ("Return to the Blue Lagoon")to somehow repeat his parents story with emphasis on own willingness to stay in this place after being acquainted with advances of civilization spoiled.Both films were short in nice location, beautiful environment also context is for loving under-age sex and nudity, one could say, mostly.
Title: The Blue Lagoon / Return to the Blue Lagoon

reviewText: I give it 3 1/2 stars. The first movie, the 1980 sappy tear-jerker should be seen with a female that you're either trying to impress or someone you're already involved with. I thought the original was okay. Plenty of beautiful scenic shots and decent job of acting by the two teens (that were ship wrecked years earlier) that are in love. Richard (Christopher Atkins) and Emmeline (Brook Shields) experience a life together that is nearly impossible in the real world. Some nice nude scenes from (what I assume) to be a stand in for Shields. The sequel 'Return To...' (1991) I thought was a complete waste of time and trouble. Didn't even come close to standing up to the first film. Upside is it comes with the original, anyway.
summary: 'Blue Lagoon' / 'Return To The Blue Lagoon' (Columbia Tristar)
